Contributing to Society through Science and Technology | Shimadzu Corporation has remained committed to commercializing cutting-edge technology and providing it to customers in a wide array of industries for more than 140 years. Our brand statement, "Excellence in Science"‚Äã, reflects our desire and attitude to diligently respond to customers'‚Äã requirements by offering superior, world-class analytical and measuring instruments, medical imaging systems, aircraft equipment and industrial machinery for the advancement of human health, the safety and security of society, and industrial processes. In today‚Äôs challenging, ever-changing landscape, Shimadzu aims to partner with customers to meet their needs with unique technologies and solutions.
data.text:
We have created a page detailing the basics of inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS). This is the third part of the learning site. In this section, we introduce the basics of quantitative and qualitative analysis using ICP-MS and how to perform internal standard correction. Please take a look.üëâ Analysis result: https://zurl.co/uaVY Click here to learn about Shimadzu‚Äôs new ICPMS: https://zurl.co/JXpd #ICPMS #InductivelyCoupledPlasmaMassSpectrometry #element #heavymetal

[News] On June 3, Shimadzu Corporation concluded a comprehensive partnership agreement with the Tokushima University, a national university, to acquire innovative technology and create businesses that contribute to solving social issues, as well as for human resource development and personnel exchanges. The two parties will conduct joint research on next-generation light source technology, food technology, and underwater communication technology. They will also foster human resources, including researchers and engineers from both sides, and Tokushima University students. Read more: https://zurl.co/o9jp #Shimadzu #TokushimaUniversity #partnership

After the positioning is complete in X-ray examinations, patients sometimes move without the operator noticing. This can necessitate retakes, resulting in increased exposure dose for the patient and extended overall examination time. With the ‚ÄòMotion Detection‚Äô feature on the RADspeed Pro SR5 Version, the system displays any patient body movement on the screen from the predetermined imaging position. If the patient moves away from the determined position, the optical camera detects the movement and provides notifications through sound and display, thereby reducing the risk of retakes. Learn more about RADspeed Pro SR5 Version here!üëâ https://lnkd.in/eubENbJG #shimadzu #RADspeedProSR5 #xray #radiography #radiology

The three load cell universal testing machine on AGX-V2 series is able to perform three tests at a time. Using this system, not only can the test be performed in 1/3 of the time, but also statistical processing such as the average value of three lines and the average curve can be displayed by the dedicated data processing software. Key features: ‚úÖ Performing three tests simultaneously reduces test time by 1/3, increasing efficiency. ‚úÖ Dedicated software removes each deflection and displays the graph in real time. ‚úÖ Possible to test either one or two specimens, depending on the test. Click here to find out more: üëâ https://zurl.co/54Kw Learn about the AGX-V2 üëâ https://zurl.co/EoU8

Surfactants analysis requires an extensive and comprehensive analysis technique. Moreover, even the same type of surfactant can take the form of numerous compounds with different chain lengths, making continuous detection essential. Within this context, targeted screening using high-resolution LC-MS is very well suited to surfactant analysis. This Application News describes a case study of comprehensive analysis using the LCMS-9030 Quadrupole Time-of-Flight (QTOF) LC-MS system by presenting the results of analysis of tea beverages spiked with surfactants. https://zurl.co/XP8B #shimadzu

On August 7, the Shimadzu Tokyo Innovation Plaza (#STIP) hosted a summer science event for elementary school students, as a part of scientific program organized by Kawasaki city. We had a great time with more than 300 children. The participants experienced scientific experiments, utilizing Energy Dispersive X-ray Fluorescence Spectroscopy to analyze treasuresüèÖ, uncovering the mysteries of CD-Rs with a Scanning Probe Microscopeüíø, making summer fans using the principle of paper chromatography.üê† It was truly remarkable to witness the children's curiosity as they explored the field of science. We sincerely hope that this experience will foster a closer connection to the scientific domain. Thank you to all who participated. This program was held 23 institutions in the #KINGSKYFRONT, an open innovation hub that creates new industry from the world's highest standard R&D, located in Tonomachi district which is designated as a national strategic special zone in Kawasaki city. üî¨Read our Harmony with Local Communities, and Support in Science Education; https://zurl.co/et5O
